quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Oh, for God’s sake. [notices Erin planking on parking lot curb]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Planking is a very stupid and dangerous trend. Basically, you lie like a plank in weird places. That’s it. Sometimes you get run over. Welcome to the Internet.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Planking is one of those things where, eh, you either get it or you don’t.  And I don’t.  But I am so excited to be a part of it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [exiting elevator] After you my good sir.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No, I insist.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I insist.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: The Search Committee finally decided, after a lot of deliberation, on Robert California… for the manager position. Who took one look around and left.  He drove down to Florida and convinced Joe to make him CEO... CEO... her own job. He talked her out of her own job. And I don’t really know how someone does that. But, anyway, then the position was his to fill.   And he chose…

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [drumroll with hands] I… it’s unbelievable. True, I may have been the second choice, but I was the first-choice’s first choice. And, about Dwight, I sensed that he might have some resentment about not getting the job so I sat him down and we had a talk. And I told him, “I need a really strong number two. I want you to be my enforcer.” Smart, right?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: (planking on top of cabinet] Very smart.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Uh, this has got to stop.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I can’t get down.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: K... Kevin! [Kevin planking on Dwight’s desk]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yeah, at first, I was really disappointed, but I’ve got a great daily routine going right now. I have upped my karate to eight times a week. I’ve added boxing - lunches and on weekends. I do kickboxing three times a week. Krav Maga four times a week. An hour of meditation every morning at sunrise and again at sunset. So yeah, I’m doin’ great.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: K, I’m gonna need some help. Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I don’t think I should.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, yeah. Pregnant.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Right here. Little Michael Scott- [points to her belly]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, I told you I don’t like that joke. It is a boy. We found out early.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Much different the second time around. And I have to say; it is nice not being the only pregnant woman in the office.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Look, it’s a ‘Little Pregs’ [points to her belly] and ‘Big Pregs’ [points to Pam’s]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Wait, when did we start calling it that-

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Isn’t it amazing, the difference in our sizes?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Well, I am a few months ahead of you.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I am having a child with my husband, the Senator. And Pam is having a child with Jim... the great salesman.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hoist him aloft. C’mon Darryl. Lift, lift Darryl. [trying to lift Kevin off desk]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: I’m lifting.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Yeah, I wanted the manager job, but I got somethin’ much better. This soda. This is mine.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: It might be easier if you take a deep breath, lift from the knees, and shove it up your butt.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: I came up with a new thing this summer. I act like I’m telling someone how to do somethin’. I go on with a long description and then I say, “and shove it up your butt.” It’s stupid, but it’s my thing now.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No one should be planking at all.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Thank you, yes. Dwight, my enforcer, my number two, can you take care of this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Say no more.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [starts attacking plankers] Kids, don’t try planking. It’s dangerous. [knocks Toby off table] ‘Specially with me around.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You watching that commercial again? [Pam nods] Why do you keep watching it, if you know it’s just gonna make you cry?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Because everything makes me cry, so what’s the difference? This dog, he just wants to protect his bone.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: He’s got a bank vault. That’s a start.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Not enough though.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: The new CEO works out of the conference room about half the time. But whenever he takes a break, he does these weird walks around the office. And you never know who he’s gonna zero in on for these really intense small-talks. You just hope it’s not you. And yet, you hope it is you too. It’s strange.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Here we go.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Robert California. Let’s have a conversation.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Describe your day so far.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Well, I woke up. And I hit the snooze-

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: And when you recount your day, never say you woke up. It’s a waste of your time. That’s how every day’s begun, for everyone, since the dawn of man.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Very smart, very smart. Suddenly, I was awake. And I’ve been doing this thing-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hey, Robert. We have that 9:30am casual chit-chat scheduled. I emailed you about it last night to confirm. And again this morning.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: First item on the agenda: can I get everyone an extra long Columbus Day weekend. Item number two, connect with the guy. Robert California, what does he think of me? Don’t know, super care. Number three, time permitting, we lost our biggest client.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Pam, pam. Psst. Pam. [motions her over, both looking at Robert’s notebook]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Jim. [motions him over]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [motions he is on the phone] Can I call you right back? Thank you very much. [comes over] Okay. [sees notebook with two lists of staff names] What is this?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: The Friday before Columbus Day. Thoughts?

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: What are your thoughts.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Just making chit-chat. Kind of a medium year for women’s soccer, no?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What are you looking at?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: It’s, it’s nothing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It can’t be nothing.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Yeah, it can’t be nothing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: It’s just a list of our names, split into two columns.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay, just wait one second, alright? I will copy it. Do you have a pen?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No. Okay. Um, I’ll take a photo of it. Dwight, can you throw me my phone?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [throws hard, Jim doesn’t catch] Nice catch.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: If he comes out, distract him. [takes list to copier]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: We need a warning signal.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: We don’t need a warning signal, Kevin. We can see him right there-

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: We do.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I promise you, we don’t need a warning-

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: WARNING! WARNING! WARNING! WARNING! WARNING!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Ahhh! [falls out of chair]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Phyllis! Phyllis! You okay? You okay?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Yeah. Yeah. Oh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: … 2, 3! [pulls Phyllis up]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Thanks guys.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay, which side of the list am I on?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Left.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Why are you- How do you know?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Really great list of names guys. Thank you so much. Good work.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Uh, no, actually. That was in Robert’s notebook.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: He left it at reception and we photocopied it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Oh, okay. I don’t want any part of this.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Maybe it’s a list of people he’s gonna fire.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay, it’s not that Pam. You know, I was thinking it reminds me of those lists Dwight used to make.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: This is if we were all on a cruise ship and had to divide into lifeboats. This is if we were on a cruise ship and had to divide into life rafts. Here’s something. Who would eat who in an ‘Alive’ situation. No... that can’t be it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I gotta say. Kinda seems like the left side’s the side to be on. Me, Jim, Dwight, Darryl. No offense Pam.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I don’t think it’s-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: ‘Scuse me?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Shhh, Pam. C’mon, don’t be such a right-sider.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Did you guys figure it out?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: We couldn’t crack it.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Go in there and just ask the man what it means.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: He’ll know that we looked at his private notebook.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: C’mon, just say you saw the list by accident.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I’m already working on this Columbus Day thing for you guys and it’s starting to stack up. Feels like a lot. One thing at a time.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Yeah, that’s all you had to do today was ask about Columbus Day?

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: [Andy continuously knocking on door] Yes, for god’s sake Andy. Yes, come in.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: What’s up? Weird thing. Totally awkward, but you left your notebook on the reception desk.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Great. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: And it was open. And people saw this. And they’re just kinda going nuts and like wondering what it is.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: What is this?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: It’s a photocopy from your notebook.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: You read my notebook? And photocopied it. And distributed it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: No. They did. And they asked me to ask about it.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Ah, please. Here’s what it is. It’s a doodle.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Some people doodle at work when they let their mind run. They draw houses, penises. Funny how the houses are always colonials and the penises are always circumcised. Don’t you think? Well, I doodle too, but I’m not an artist. So I draw words and lists.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: That is fascinating. And, by the way, I am so glad I asked. People were just sort of- Did you just move my name?

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Might as well have been sketching a cube.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Okay. Robert’s in the annex, everybody think quick. What do these groups have in common?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Maybe we’re s’posed to do it with people in our group.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That’s not it.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: People in the other group.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Mmum, still wrong.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Stanley, you do puzzles all day. Whatdo we got?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Well, you take the first letter from each name, assign it a number, add ‘em all up, and SHOVE IT UP YOUR BUTT!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Thank you. A little much needed comic relief, but we really need to figure this out guys.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I know! It’s alphabetical.

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.line: [separately] No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No, it’s not. Here’s how we find out. Let’s line up and compare the lines, see if we learn anything. Okay, left-siders over here. Right-siders, line up over here. Face each other. Match it by height and relative weight. Let’s just size each other up here and left side of the list… ATTACK!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Wait, wait, wait! Stop! Stop! Stop! Will you stop?! [Kelly and Erin screaming as Dwight bashes their heads together, everyone attacking each other and yelling]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Warning! Warning! Warning!

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: [enters room, everyone quiets and separates] I’d like to invite the following people to join me for lunch: Jim, Dwight, Angela, Darryl, Kevin, Toby, Phyllis, Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That’s great. Let’s do this guys.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Alright, well, I will see you in a bit.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I love you so much. [starting to cry]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey. It’s nothing. Alright? I’ll text you when we get there. Let you know what’s going on.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Okay. [turns to computer]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Nope. No dog video.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay. See you guys.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Well, we should all be really excited about our very own pizza party. Pizza partay! Pizza! Partay! Pizza! Partay!

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Jim, your daughter, Cecilia. What does she think of the street?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Uhhh, the street?

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Sesame street.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, I didn’t know anybody called it- She likes it a lot- she, uh, loves Elmo.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Elmo, god’s sake, it’s the Elmo era.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Right.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Sesame Street was created to reflect the environment of the children watching it. Complete self-absorption of Elmo is brilliantly reflective of our time. Ours is a cultural ghetto. Wouldn’t you agree.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah, she does like Elmo.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Cultural ghetto? Totally- totally agree.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Completely.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Apt. Apt analysis, Robert.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: The thing that I like about Elmo is the tickling.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I should not be here. I’m in the- I was in the wrong- I’m- I’m sorry. Uh, just picture me back there. I- I was never here.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Great group! Pizza party!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: How is this a pizza party?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Well, why don’t you ask me again when the five pizzas get here.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Yeah, well, that’s just pizza. You need at least one other element for it to be a party.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Okay. You guys ever had Margarita pizza?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: What’s that?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Fresh tomato with a dollop of mozzarella cheese.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: That’s pizza.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: That’s regular pizza.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You know, I feel comfortable enough now to ask you this question... what made you pick this group?

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: I just think you guys are winners and I wanted to have lunch with you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay!

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.line: [separately] Awww.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Well, what about the other guys.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Losers.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: C’mon.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: I don’t- I don’t wanna say-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: C’mon, c’mon.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: No, no.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: C’mon.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Ha, I guess I think they’re losers.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ha ha, I knew it! Ha ha! Yes! Woo!

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Probably shouldn’t have said that. [Jim’s jaw drops]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Ah hah! Their interpretation of Margarita pizza. Fans of classic pizza will be psyched.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [Pam’s phone vibrates] Oh, text from Jim. “This is getting very weird. Will explain later.”

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [Everyone’s phone vibrates] Oh, text from Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: “Suck it losers.”

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Okay, not to point out the glaringly obvious, but doesn’t the fact that I’m in this group make anyone feel just a little bit better? Oh! This crust is sharp!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I used to be young and cute and sorta funny and I could do those cute, little cartoons. And everyone who came through here was like, “Who’s that receptionist? I like her.” Now I’m just a fat mom. Yeah, and you take one look at me and you’re like, “Oh, loser.”

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: C’mon Pam. Chins up, okay? Bad joke. Look around this room. Does this look like a group of losers? Seriously?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh. Oh God.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: [door opens, others enter] Oh. Hey guys! We had so much fun. We had Margarita pizza. We all hung out. Got to know each other better. How was your lunch?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: It was excellent.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Good times.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, we did. It was the best time. And you know what? Now it’s over. Back to work everyone. You too Andy.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I knew it. I just knew, my whole life, that everyone was wrong about me. My parents, my teachers, my friends, the doctors. Everyone.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Well, that was certainly an odd lunch. Is everything alright?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah, I’m fine.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [spraying Meredith and Creed with water gun] Loser. Losers. [Dwight holding up “L” to his forehead]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: [on the phone, while getting sprayed] Just take the casserole out of the- Take it out of the refrigerator and put it in the oven. It’ll be fine, just leave it in for 20 minutes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: When I was a salesman I could just be like “Not my job, not my prob. I’m going to the warehouse to polish my knob.” Metaphorically, of course. But now, it is my job and my prob.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hi, Robert? Can you come out here please it’s really important. Just wanted to clarify something. Some people here are under the misconception that some people may be considered, uh, let’s say top-tier and others would be second-tier.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: I never said that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Thank you. Great.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Oh, that, it might- That might actually be what I’m thinking of. Can you clarify that?

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Let me tell you some things I find productive. Positive reinforcement. Negative reinforcement. Honesty. I’ll tell you some things I find unproductive. Constantly worrying about where you stand based on inscrutable social clues. And then, inevitably reframing it all in a reassuring way so that you can get to sleep at night. No, I do not believe in that at all. If I invited you to lunch, I think you’re a winner. If I didn’t, I don’t. But I just met you all. Life is long, opinions change. Winners prove me right. Losers, prove me wrong.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Whew, well. I guess that’s that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: No. No, no.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Andy, don’t go in there!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I’m going in there.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I know that every time I talk to you things just seem to get worse. But, you don’t know these people and I do. And if I let you work with faulty information, well, then I’m not doing my job as regional manager. So, please take this pen and change your list.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: I’m not gonna change my list, Andy, and I don’t use ballpoint pens.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Well, then I will make a new list for you. Stanley... you may think he’s a lazy grump, but did you know that he has the most consistently high sales numbers of anyone in this office? And you may think he’s hard to love, but did you know that he’s in, not one, but two long-term romantic relationships?

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: I did not know about the sales figures.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Meredith Palmer... Supplier relations. The word “no” not even in her vocabulary. And just to show you that I’m being fair. You had Gabe in the loser column. I think that is astute. Good call. Pam, easily the most creative and kind person I have ever worked with.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Jim, shut the door. This is just gross.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Shhh.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Erin Hannon, the receptionist and my closest confidant. A winner if there ever was one.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: I like my new group. I liked my old group.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Are we done?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yes. No! The Friday before Columbus Day, we’re gonna take a half-day, so that everyone can get a jump on the long weekend.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: You want a three and half day weekend for Columbus Day?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yes, I do.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: And you are aware that Columbus and his legions committed genocide against an entire civilization of Native Americans.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I don’t care. [Robert smiles as Andy exits]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hey guys. So Columbus Day, we got that half-day on Friday.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: We get that every year.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Well, you got it this year too.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Good night, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Night.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Bye.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Good night Andy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Good night.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Night.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Alright, I’m gonna go warm up the car.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Okay. Oh, uh, you dropped something. Jim?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Okay, I know I’ve been crying easily today, but- [shows unfolded paper Jim dropped, shows two lists, “Pam” and “Cece” on one side, “Everything else” on the other] I mean, that’s just pretty killer, right? I mean, maybe it’s stupid. No. [starts crying] It’s wonderful. I’m gonna frame it. I can always unframe it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I gotta say, I think it's kinda cool not knowing. It's like one of those movies that ends on a note of mystery. Did the butler do it? Are they ghosts? You know? It's kinda sophisticated.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Everybody hates those endings!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [weepy] Yeah, I hate those endings.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I- [Sees Kevin looking at the list upside down and turns it.]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I was looking for patterns.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I know.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: It's all a mind game. He wanted us to see the list. He's a genius. You guys just don't get him.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: I made a list like this for Congress when I worked in Hollywood in the 50's, they're meaningless.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Guys. Really, it's ok. Everyone has made a really solid first impression, I don't think there's any reason for anybody to worry.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I am on the wrong side, and I am freaking out here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [grunting, trying with Jim to lift Kevin planking on his desk] Man, it's like hoisting a manatee. I can't get a grip it's so vast.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Ryan? A little help?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: God. How do whalers do it?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Here's the way trends move across the country. They start in Japan. L.A. And New York get it soon after that. Seattle looks at it, decides not to do it. Chicago gets it three months later. Then it travels down the Mississippi, OK? All the red states start doing it. Good Morning America does a piece about it. And then, it shows up in Scranton.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Creed! Wha- [Shoves Creed with his foot, Creed grunts] This is a safety issue with you. There's no way to know if you're dead!

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Good morning. [suitcase falls and he laughs awkwardly]

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Corporate wants me up here, Dunder Mifflin wants me down there. What they worked out is that Monday, Wednesday and Friday I'm here in Scranton, Tuesday Thursday I'm in Tallahassee, I mean I feel like Vera Farmiga in Up in the Air, you know? More money more problems. Although, I didn't get a raise, so you know. Same money, more problems.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: It's called owling. You'll read about it in like eight months.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Uh, I will have the chicken piccata with a side salad.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: That sounds good.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Chicken piccata, side salad.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Chicken piccata, salad on the side please.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I'll start with a side salad and uh, oh, chicken piccata.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Chicken piccata, side salad.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Side salad, chicken piccata on the side.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I'll start with a side salad, then a chicken piccata.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Steak. Rare.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Jim, you alright? What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Good. What? Nothin'

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh! Text from Jim. “This is...” hmm.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Profound man, your husband.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: One more. To our boss!

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.line: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I don't think we have to do this again cause it's gonna take a whole. [everyone clinks glasses]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You know what? Let us treat you. What do you say? It has been such a pleasure.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: I can expense it.

quotes.speaker: Darryl and Oscar
quotes.line: Let him expense it, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I insist. It is gonna be our treat, please?

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Waiter
quotes.line: Hi, Mr. Shrute. I've waited on you before. I just wanted to let you know that gratuity is not included in the bill and tips are expected.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, tips are expected?

quotes.speaker: Waiter
quotes.line: Yes sir.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Then expect to be shocked. Jim, you owe me $14.75. Oscar, $14.75. Darryl....

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: My entire childhood, I was the one left out, and I said to myself: Gabe, if you just achieve some success, you'll be part of them. You'll be part of the happy ones. But instead, people just used my success as a new way to shut me out.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Hey, this ain't no Breakfast Club, bitch.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Whoo! Yeah! Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Come on, man.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Winners!
